subject: Need Help in Writing Test Case
msgSnippet: Hello, I am new to unit testing and using junit4, jmock2 with STS 2.3.2. I am trying to write a testcase for a concrete class. The skeleton code is as below.
messageBody:
Hello,

I am new to unit testing and using junit4, jmock2 with STS 2.3.2.

I am trying to write a testcase for a concrete class. The skeleton
code is as below. What I want to do is


mockSetter's method will a set a value via paramter that value
i want to save to some variable or to disk file and would like
to refer/read from file when mockSetter's method is called
and return. I would like to compare original value given to
context object's set value method with returned value from
context objects's get value method. These two method' are
invoking mockSetter and mockgetter methods after some processing
the test tests this processing's reversability.

How should I design the testcase.

Thanks and best regards

Raja


public class testDateTypeHandler {

private Mockery context;
private ResultGetter mockGetter;
private ParameterSetter mockSetter;
private DateTypeHandler dateHandler;
private String s;

@Before
public void setUp() throws Exception {
context = new JUnit4Mockery();
mockGetter = context.mock(ResultGetter.class);
mockSetter = context.mock(ParameterSetter.class);
dateHandler = new DateTypeHandler();
}

@After
public void tearDown() throws Exception {}

@Test(expected = java.sql.SQLException.class)
public void testGetResult() throws SQLException {
fail("Not yet implemented");
}

}
